\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 70363}

\subsection*{Interesting Side Effect}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{Mooseman}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 & 600 mg & oral & St. John's Wort & capsule\\
\hline
 T+ 0:00 & 60 mg & oral & Ginkgo biloba & capsule\\
\hline
 T+ 0:00 &  repeated & smoked & Tobacco - Cigarettes & plant material\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 185.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
Over the last two weeks or so I've been taking two caps of 300mg St. John's Wort Extract (.3\% Hypericin), along with two 60mg Ginkgo caps for about a week.  While it hasn't made much of a difference in my daily mood other than a bit of anxiety relief from my hectic day-to-day college business (I'm usually not too depressed anyway), it has really affected the way my body deals with nicotine.  I'd usually get a pretty good buzz from a cigarette at the end of a long day, but now\ldots..nothing.  It kinda sucks, because I've never really smoked much, maybe 2-3 cigarettes a day at most, and have had no intentions of quitting because I really enjoy the occasional cigarette, but now its as if I have no reason to, nor do I want to anymore other than to fulfill the need to have something in my mouth.

\end{document}
